javelin.model.world.location.town

Class Town

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.WorldActor
      • javelin.model.world.location.Location
        • javelin.model.world.location.town.Town
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Town
extends Location
    A hub for upgrading units, resting, participating in tournament, renting transportation, buying items... Each town has it's own profile which is predetermined.
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        gold in bank when all members of a squad are training

      • events

        public java.util.ArrayList<Exhibition> events

      • size

        public int size
        Represent 10 working citizens that will produce 1 labor every 10 days. An arbitrary decision is to try to fit the game-span of a normal game into a 1-year period, which puts a town max size roughly at 10 if it does nothing but Grow.

      • labor

        public float labor
        Can be used to improve a town. 1 unit represents 10 days of work by a 10-men crew.

      • automanage

        public boolean automanage

      • research

        public ResearchData research
        Contains Research data structures.

      • nexttask

        public Research nexttask
        Next task for the automanager.

      • lodging

        public Accommodations lodging
        Higher levels allow better rest.

      • transport

        public Transport transport
        Higher levels allow better travel methods.

                        long hours,

      • getel

        protected java.lang.Integer getel(int attackerel)
        Description copied from class: Location
        Only called for Location.sacrificeable places when being reached by an Incursion.
        Specified by:
        getel in class Location
        Parameters:
        attackerel - Given an attacking encounter level...
        Returns:
        the defending encounter level. A null value is allowed because some places should not be conquered. Integer.MIN_VALUE means an automatic victory for the attacker.
        See Also:
        WorldActor.impermeable, Incursion.fight(int, int)

      • interact

        Overrides:
        interact in class Location
        Returns:
        true if the World should react after this interaction.

      • upgradeinn

        public Accommodations upgradeinn()
        Note that this method doesn't actually change lodging.
        Returns:
        The next step on the lodging tree, up to Accommodations.HOSPITAL.

      • upgradetransport

        public Transport upgradetransport()
        Note that this method doesn't actually change transport.
        Returns:
        The next step on the transport tree, up to Transport.AIRSHIP.

        Overrides:

        Returns:

      • getworker

        public static void getworker(Town t)
        Adds a Worker units to the active Squad.
        Parameters:
        t - If not null will reduce town size by 1. If already at 1 (minimum) returns without any effect.

      • getcombatants

        public java.util.List<Combatant> getcombatants()
        Specified by:
        getcombatants in class WorldActor
        Returns:
        Any combatants that are situated in this actor, may return null if this is not a valid request for this type of actor. For performance if a List is returned it should be the canonical one, and thus should not be directly modified by the receiver.
        See Also:
        Combatant.newid()

      • haslabor

        public boolean haslabor()
        Returns:
        true if it's probably a good idea for a player to return here and manager this town.
        See Also:
        automanage, labor, TownManager
